trans-unit.source: Connect to mySAP Business Suite in a BizTalk Services Project
trans-unit.target: Connect to mySAP Business Suite in a BizTalk Services Project

trans-unit.source: There are three overall steps to connect to mySAP Business Suite application from a <token>af_integration</token> project.
trans-unit.target: There are three overall steps to connect to mySAP Business Suite application from a <token>af_integration</token> project.

trans-unit.source: Create an <token>lobtarget</token> for mySAP Business Suite.
trans-unit.target: Create an <token>lobtarget</token> for mySAP Business Suite.

trans-unit.source: To create an <token>lobtarget</token> for SAP, you must be a member of the local Administrators group and have the System Administrator right on the on-premises SAP system.
trans-unit.target: To create an <token>lobtarget</token> for SAP, you must be a member of the local Administrators group and have the System Administrator right on the on-premises SAP system.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio must be opened with Administrative privileges.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio must be opened with Administrative privileges.

trans-unit.source: On a 64-bit server, also install the 32-bit SAP client libraries to the <legacyItalic>drive</legacyItalic>:\Windows\SysWOW64 folder.
trans-unit.target: On a 64-bit server, also install the 32-bit SAP client libraries to the <legacyItalic>drive</legacyItalic>:\Windows\SysWOW64 folder.

trans-unit.source: Generate schema for the operation to be performed on the SAP application.
trans-unit.target: Generate schema for the operation to be performed on the SAP application.

trans-unit.source: These steps assume you have a <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: These steps assume you have a <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Install Azure BizTalk Services SDK</link> lists the requirements.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Install Azure BizTalk Services SDK</link> lists the requirements.

trans-unit.source: To add an <token>lobtarget</token> for mySAP Business Suite
trans-unit.target: To add an <token>lobtarget</token> for mySAP Business Suite

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, expand <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold>, expand the Management URL, and then expand <legacyBold>LOB Types</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, expand <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold>, expand the Management URL, and then expand <legacyBold>LOB Types</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: In Connection Parameters, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In Connection Parameters, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Application Server</legacyBold>: The server name or IP address of the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Application Server</legacyBold>: The server name or IP address of the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Advanced</legacyBold>: Select this button to configure additional Connection Properties and any Binding Properties.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Advanced</legacyBold>: Select this button to configure additional Connection Properties and any Binding Properties.

trans-unit.source: The SAP adapter supports the following client connection types:
trans-unit.target: The SAP adapter supports the following client connection types:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>A</legacyBold>: An application host-based connection to SAP.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>A</legacyBold>: An application host-based connection to SAP.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>B</legacyBold>: A load balanced connection to SAP.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>B</legacyBold>: A load balanced connection to SAP.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>D</legacyBold>: A destination-based connection using the destination in the saprfc.ini file to SAP.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>D</legacyBold>: A destination-based connection using the destination in the saprfc.ini file to SAP.

trans-unit.source: The host name or the IP address of the SAP Application server.
trans-unit.target: The host name or the IP address of the SAP Application server.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Destination listed in the saprfc.ini file.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Destination listed in the saprfc.ini file.

trans-unit.source: When adapter executes, the SAP GUI displays automatically and break into the AGAP code.
trans-unit.target: When adapter executes, the SAP GUI displays automatically and break into the AGAP code.

trans-unit.source: RFC SDK traces are not written to the .trc files.
trans-unit.target: RFC SDK traces are not written to the .trc files.

trans-unit.source: RFC SDK traces are written to the .trc files.
trans-unit.target: RFC SDK traces are written to the .trc files.

trans-unit.source: The level tracing is determined by the RFC_TRACE environment variable:
trans-unit.target: The level tracing is determined by the RFC_TRACE environment variable:

trans-unit.source: If RFC_TRACE is missing or set to 0 (zero), tracing is not enabled.
trans-unit.target: If RFC_TRACE is missing or set to 0 (zero), tracing is not enabled.

trans-unit.source: If RFC_TRACE is set to 1, tracing is enabled.
trans-unit.target: If RFC_TRACE is set to 1, tracing is enabled.

trans-unit.source: The application server group name in SAP.
trans-unit.target: The application server group name in SAP.

trans-unit.source: The host name or the IP address of the SAP Message server.
trans-unit.target: The host name or the IP address of the SAP Message server.

trans-unit.source: The R/3 System name in SAP.
trans-unit.target: The R/3 System name in SAP.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Destination listed in the saprfc.ini file.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Destination listed in the saprfc.ini file.

trans-unit.source: If you enter the Destination Name property, this value is taken from the saprfc.ini file.
trans-unit.target: If you enter the Destination Name property, this value is taken from the saprfc.ini file.

trans-unit.source: Secure Network Communication (SNC) is not used.
trans-unit.target: Secure Network Communication (SNC) is not used.

trans-unit.source: Do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> enter a user name and password in the Connection.
trans-unit.target: Do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> enter a user name and password in the Connection.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>SncLibrary</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>SncPartnerName</legacyBold> binding properties must be specified in the Connection.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>SncLibrary</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>SncPartnerName</legacyBold> binding properties must be specified in the Connection.

trans-unit.source: To configure the <legacyBold>Binding Properties</legacyBold> tab, refer to <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for mySAP Business Suite Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228977</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To configure the <legacyBold>Binding Properties</legacyBold> tab, refer to <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for mySAP Business Suite Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228977</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following binding properties are also available:
trans-unit.target: The following binding properties are also available:

trans-unit.source: The LogOn ticket that is passed to SAP.
trans-unit.target: The LogOn ticket that is passed to SAP.

trans-unit.source: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: Determines whether the LogOn ticket is used for authentication to SAP.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether the LogOn ticket is used for authentication to SAP.

trans-unit.source: No LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.
trans-unit.target: No LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.

trans-unit.source: Can be used with BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: Can be used with BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: MySapSSO1 LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.
trans-unit.target: MySapSSO1 LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.

trans-unit.source: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: MySapSSO2 LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.
trans-unit.target: MySapSSO2 LogOn ticket is used to authenticate to SAP.

trans-unit.source: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: Cannot be used with BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: Gets or sets the External Identification Data.
trans-unit.target: Gets or sets the External Identification Data.

trans-unit.source: Used when the <embeddedLabel>Use SNC</embeddedLabel> Connection property is set to True.
trans-unit.target: Used when the <embeddedLabel>Use SNC</embeddedLabel> Connection property is set to True.

trans-unit.source: Gets or sets the External Identification Type.
trans-unit.target: Gets or sets the External Identification Type.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>The SAP System Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=228976</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information on the SAP adapter.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>The SAP System Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=228976</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information on the SAP adapter.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Specify the credentials</legacyBold>: Enter the credentials to authenticate to the on-premises SAP system.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Specify the credentials</legacyBold>: Enter the credentials to authenticate to the on-premises SAP system.

trans-unit.source: The logged on user credentials are used to connect to the SAP system.
trans-unit.target: The logged on user credentials are used to connect to the SAP system.

trans-unit.source: Use the following UserName and Password
trans-unit.target: Use the following UserName and Password

trans-unit.source: Enter a <embeddedLabel>User name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Password</embeddedLabel> that can connect to the SAP system.
trans-unit.target: Enter a <embeddedLabel>User name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Password</embeddedLabel> that can connect to the SAP system.

trans-unit.source: Not all options may be available for this LOB adapter.
trans-unit.target: Not all options may be available for this LOB adapter.

trans-unit.source: In Operations, expand the node, select the database operation, and select the right arrow:
trans-unit.target: In Operations, expand the node, select the database operation, and select the right arrow:

trans-unit.source: The following links provide additional details on selecting an operation:
trans-unit.target: The following links provide additional details on selecting an operation:

trans-unit.source: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for RFC Operations
trans-unit.target: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for RFC Operations

trans-unit.source: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for BAPI Operations
trans-unit.target: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for BAPI Operations

trans-unit.source: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for IDOC Operations
trans-unit.target: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for IDOC Operations

trans-unit.source: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for tRFC Operations
trans-unit.target: Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for tRFC Operations

trans-unit.source: To see the operation’s generated WSDL, select the operation, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To see the operation’s generated WSDL, select the operation, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Runtime Security, enter the security type.
trans-unit.target: In Runtime Security, enter the security type.

trans-unit.source: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.

trans-unit.source: In Deployment, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: In Deployment, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.
trans-unit.target: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.

trans-unit.source: There are restrictions based on the security model.
trans-unit.target: There are restrictions based on the security model.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.
trans-unit.target: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.

trans-unit.source: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name is required.
trans-unit.target: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name is required.

trans-unit.source: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key is required.
trans-unit.target: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key is required.

trans-unit.source: Enter the desired name of the relay path.
trans-unit.target: Enter the desired name of the relay path.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you use chose Fixed Windows credentials option for Runtime Security, you can enter something like <legacyItalic>WindowsAuthRelay</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you use chose Fixed Windows credentials option for Runtime Security, you can enter something like <legacyItalic>WindowsAuthRelay</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path and target sub-path specified.
trans-unit.target: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path and target sub-path specified.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:

trans-unit.source: The following activities occur in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following activities occur in the background:

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: Its configuration can also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Its configuration can also be exported.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the relay endpoint in Server Explorer, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the relay endpoint in Server Explorer, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select the security method you want to use, and enter their values.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select the security method you want to use, and enter their values.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.

trans-unit.source: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: The default value of the property is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: The default value of the property is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Open the .config file for the LOB target, which typically has the <legacyItalic>RelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> name.
trans-unit.target: Open the .config file for the LOB target, which typically has the <legacyItalic>RelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> name.

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the config file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the config file.

trans-unit.source: Once a <token>lobtarget</token> is configured and added to the design area, add a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token> to be the source.
trans-unit.target: Once a <token>lobtarget</token> is configured and added to the design area, add a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token> to be the source.

trans-unit.source: Use Connector in the Toolbox to connect the bridge to the lobtarget, similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Use Connector in the Toolbox to connect the bridge to the lobtarget, similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> provide more specific information on the <token>xml_bridge</token> and any additional properties that must be configured.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> provide more specific information on the <token>xml_bridge</token> and any additional properties that must be configured.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> property of the <token>lobtarget</token> to send messages to the on-premises LOB system.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> property of the <token>lobtarget</token> to send messages to the on-premises LOB system.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the <token>lobtarget</token> you created, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to <legacyItalic><project_name></legacyItalic></embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the <token>lobtarget</token> you created, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to <legacyItalic><project_name></legacyItalic></embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This value is prefixed with all the schema files that are generated.
trans-unit.target: This value is prefixed with all the schema files that are generated.

trans-unit.source: You can also enter the folder name under which the schemas are added in the Visual Studio Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can also enter the folder name under which the schemas are added in the Visual Studio Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The default value for the folder is <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The default value for the folder is <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select a credential type to generate the schema, enter the values for authentication, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a credential type to generate the schema, enter the values for authentication, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schemas are added to the project under the folder name.
trans-unit.target: The schemas are added to the project under the folder name.
